attributes.action: Offer support mentally for citizens dealing with life changing disabilities
attributes.background: For example, many people in the UK suffer with a life limiting/ changing disability. Help as such as how to operate a wheelchair, how to tune cochlear implants etc is provided by the nhs. No help mentally is provided to help people adjust to their new lives.
attributes.additional_details: I know many people including myself who have suffered from a life changing disability. Obviously these disabilites have a major effect on our life and how we see it. Out of everyone i know, not one fraction of us was offered someone to talk to.

attributes.action: Agency workers need to be protected against unfair dismissal by law.
attributes.background: After being let go from an agency working position, I realised that agency workers have little to no rights or protection when it comes to unfair dismissal or even being able to have times off for emergencies (unlike their contracted counterparts).

attributes.action: The mandatory installation of an automatic braking system in all lorries
attributes.background: Due to the recent tragic accidental killing of a family of four people by a lorry with a distracted driver, I petition that all lorries be fitted with an mandatory automatic braking system that would come into force if the driver were incapacitated or distracted.

attributes.action: Drivers causing death by dangerous driving should be banned for life,
attributes.background: Due to the amount of fatalities caused by drivers who have no respect for other road users ; mobile phones being a prime example, a car should be classed as a weapon in the wrong hands.

attributes.action: Make students learn how to manage money and finance in secondary schools
attributes.background: Students need to learn how to manage their bills and buy food on set budgets. This can greatly improve the standards of young people so that they can go into the world and know what to do with their wage and their savings, instead of wasting money.

attributes.action: Make education of communism and its policies mandatory in all education
attributes.background: People need to be aware of the potential of a better life

attributes.action: Decommission Sellafield safely and responsibly, it is too dangerous.
attributes.background:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iUE2846zgCA  
This link shows you a report about the dangers of the SELLAFIELD NUCLEAR INSTALLATION.
I call upon - all people in 200 miles of the SELLAFIELD NUCLEAR INSTALLATION, elected members of the government,  and anyone who loves our country, and its people.
attributes.additional_details:
It came to my attention recently that the Sellafield installation is actually in a state of overloading and dangerously falling into disrepair, due to lack of investment and reductions of staff. 
I ask you all to come together to force the authorities to make the necessary decisions to ensure the safety and security of this installation, which threatens the health and lives of many uk residents.

attributes.action: Ban all non prescription flea treatment for pets in the UK
attributes.background: With 13 million UK households owning a pet, it's common for people to rely on cheap flea treatment. Some non prescription flea treatments do NOT work effectively and will not kill fleas. Studies find that they may, however, kill your pets.
attributes.additional_details:
Not only do these treatments not work but they may actually be dangerous. 

A simple Google search reveals that hundreds of dogs and cats have fallen victim to the ingredients used in cheaper treatments and hundreds have actually died. 

Whilst it's understandably difficult to afford proper flea treatment, this is the price of having a pet and as their owners, we are fully responsible.

Please sign to make any non prescription flea treatment illegal.

attributes.action: Hold a parliamentary debate on the re-introduction of selective State Education
attributes.background: The Government has announced the return of selection in Secondary Education in England without any manifesto commitment or mandate to do so and 40 years after it was abolished as socially divisive and intrinsically unfair to the economically less advantaged.
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister argues that the re-introduction of grammar schools will enhance social mobility. However the evidence on the ground in those few areas where selective education remains entrenched is that though it may do so for the lucky few, many more are left behind. Selection favours affluent families who pay for the extra coaching to pass the selection tests and obstructs access for the poorest.

attributes.action: DLA low rate mobility and standard rate pip mobility entitled to a free car
attributes.background: Everybody on mobility part PIP/DLA low rate should be entitled to a free car

attributes.action: Build a minimum of 100,000 social/council houses per year
attributes.background: With immigration at over 300,000 per year for the last 15 years we do not have enough housing. Private landlords are taking over £9bn a year in housing benefit. This money should be spent on building social housing where low income persons can feel secure in a long term tenancy.
attributes.additional_details: The surge in HMO's - House of Multiple Occupancy and extortionate private rents is forcing people to live in poor conditions. Social housing with long term tenancies will help to create a better community where people can call their house a home. Private letting creates a transient community of people leaving and moving every few months and destabilises peoples lives for work, health care and general community cohesion.

attributes.action: Up the fine for driving using a mobile to six points off license and £500.
attributes.background: Everyday I see dozens of drivers flouting this law and families are wrecked as a result. The present penalties are woefully inadequate and provide very little deterrent.

attributes.action: Ban the use of Poultry Manure being spread on fields for agricultural use.
attributes.background: Over the past several years Poultry Manure has been introduced rather than Cow manure on agricultural land. If the wind is blowing just slightly, then you can't go outside the house without the nauseating and gut-wrenching smell that comes off the Manure.

attributes.action: Scrap the 7 day week NHS proposals or fund them by the amount the BMA requires.
attributes.background: The "7 day week" proposals would stretch the already stretched resources and people of the NHS well past breaking point, and do Not provide the funding and staff required. The petition to have Mr Hunt removed was brushed aside, can we at least agree his policies need removing?
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence is in the proposals themselves and the medical practitioner's need to strike over such an unreasonable contract. No further evidence of inadequate provision is required, the burden of proof lies with those trying to push through the contract.
The BMA are the organisation representing the NHS and it's staff.

attributes.action: Charge those who misuse public services through drink or drug abuse.
attributes.background: Charge those who misuse public services, such as the ambulance service, police, fire service or the NHS, through drink or drug abuse. Use the money raised through these charges to improve those services, funding things like cancer research, police on the streets, keep hospitals open.
attributes.additional_details:
An article from The Telegraph in 2015 in reference to the government looking into the cost of obesity, drug abuse and alcoholism to the UK economy.

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/health/news/11769531/Cost-of-obesity-drug-abuse-and-alcoholism-to-be-revealed.html

attributes.action: Reduce VAT on Food & Drink in cafe's etc. to 10% & lower the threshold to £40K
attributes.background: Across Europe there are 14 member countries that charge VAT at 10% or less on food and drink served in pubs, cafes, restaurants etc. Some small businesses falsely declare lower turnovers to ensure they do not come into the VAT scope. Café A pays 20% VAT being honest, Café B pays 0 and avoid VAT.
attributes.additional_details: If the VAT is reduced to 10% this would have a positive effect on the economy and tourism. By lowering the threshold on the same you bring more businesses into scope which would benefit the treasury for the lost VAT income and reduce fraudulent under declaring of turnover closing a tax avoidance loophole. It would also mean that there was a level playing field for businesses to compete and encourage growth. The general public would receive better value and comparison if all on the same tax

attributes.action: Offer more medical school places
attributes.background: The GMC limit the number of places avaliable for students studying medicine at university. By keeping the number of places the same, doctors numbers within the NHS won't rise putting patient care at risk. By offering more places longer term the NHS can employ more doctors and improve patient care

attributes.action: Require all animal breeding for commercial (sale) purposes to be licensed
attributes.background:
Only the breeding of dogs is currently licensed, while current sale legislation (Pet Animals Act 1951), is outdated and does little to protect animals.

We put it to Parliament that the licensing standard for dog breeding should extend to all animals which are bred for commercial (sale) purposes.
attributes.additional_details:
A bill on the breeding and sale of cats had its first reading in the House of Lords in 2015, but has not progressed any further. 

The explanatory notes from said reading provide a background and review some of the issues that result from a lack of regulation in the breeding and sale of animals: https://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/bills/lbill/2015-2016/0033/en/16033en01.htm

attributes.action: Pensions for nurses Who have worked forty years and are over sixty
attributes.background:
Nurses over sixty are struggling to work in physically exhausting jobs.
We nursed in the seventies lifting heavy patients without hoists.
We used the Austrailian lift where we literally lifted the patient on our backs.
Long term hard physical and emotional nursing takes its toll.
attributes.additional_details:
Most of my friends are nurses, none of them have been able to keep going.
Let us have our state pension that we worked so hard for.
 I didn't expect to be in this position after forty five years of hard physical work I need dignity in retirement.

attributes.action: Introduce and enforce a trade embargo on Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia have an appalling human rights record. Homosexual acts are punishable by death and women are treated legally as second class citizens. In addition to their medieval society, there is evidence that the Saudi regime funds Sunni terrorists organisations. We cannot do business with them.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/saudi-arabia/local-laws-and-customs
"The Saudi legal system differs in many ways from the UK. Suspects can be held without charge and are not always allowed quick access to legal representation. The Saudi authorities have detained witnesses and victims of crimes."
"It is illegal for women to drive."
"The public practice of any form of religion other than Islam is illegal"

attributes.action: Make it an offence to impersonate any of our emergency services.
attributes.background:
At present, in the U.K it is only an offence to impersonate a Police Officer and not any of our other emergency services.
With this loop hole, we have members of the public masquerading as Paramedics, Fire Officers and more. This leaves Police officers powerless to act.
attributes.additional_details:
I have produced a short documentary to prove my point, which you can view here.

https://youtu.be/E4k1NOhABWQ

attributes.action: Reduce alcohol duty. High duty disproportionately penalises the poor.
attributes.background: Higher prices do not prevent alcoholism. Reducing duties to a level similar to Belgium will allow, responsible, poorer drinkers to enjoy better quality drinks without having to sacrifice other things.

attributes.action: Enable Young Couples to Rent by Regulating HMO Licenses
attributes.background:
Young professionals are being forced out of Cities such as Oxford and Cambridge to move back in with their parents due to lack of housing caused by HMO regulations.
We need to have the regulations changed so councils cannot go as low as 2 households / 3 people to require an HMO license.
attributes.additional_details:
Many councils have implemented regulations that prevent more than THREE people residing in a dwelling. Even if TWO of those are a renting couple.

While HMOs may have increased the number of rooms to rent, it is equally removing the amount of available properties for young professionals. Our government should be aware and improve these HMO regulations to ensure more availability.
I strongly believe this will help stabilise housing and help hundreds of individuals who are a value to our cities.

attributes.action: A better awareness of endometriosis within NHS and treatments available.
attributes.background: It can take years to diagnose condition, lack of understanding and knowledge within communities, more information and support available for sufferers, it may not be cancer but this is a slow crippling disease affecting your body and mind.

attributes.action: PARKING TICKETS: Put clear signage & road markings in restricted parking areas.
attributes.background: Council's should display more signs & have road markings identifying restricted/permit parking areas. Currently, they only have to have a sign on the entrance of the road. These signs can be easily missed, then consequently people are being fined up to £70. This is unfair and needs to be changed.
attributes.additional_details: The requirements for Local Authorities to erect 'Permit Holders Only' repeater signs has been removed which anables the local councils to make more money on these permit holders only areas by not informing the public that the area they are parked in is permit only areas. This is purely a money making scheme and nothing else.

attributes.action: To debate the political impartiality of the Speaker of the House of Commons.
attributes.background: The Speaker of the House of Commons is meant to be impartial. Our Parliament successfully functions because of a set of values, rules and processes. Infringing these rules undermines Parliamentary Democracy and the Institution of Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: MPs should consider the Speakers' recently expressed opinion on foreign policy matters, particularly his hostile position to a US Presidential address and his welcoming stance in relation to countries with a history of human rights abuse including China, Singapore, Indonesia and Kuwait. His inconsistent tolerance of applause in the Commons (acceptable at the end of his own speech and not at the end of SNP speeches) should also be considered.

attributes.action: Merge health and social care for the elderly and fund from increased income tax.
attributes.background: A single management line for health and social care would increase efficiency and increased taxation is the fairest way to fund proper care.  Seven day medical and social services would enable capital resources to be better utilised.

attributes.action: request that the government consider 'rewilding' Britain to help save ecosystems
attributes.background: many animals that are now extinct or endangered in this country have been proven to greatly improve the countryside of other countries, such as beavers being effective flood defenders. to restore the natural balance in our ecosystems, the government should consider proposals from Rewilding Britain.
attributes.additional_details: some of the animals considered to be reintroduced are: lynx, beaver, boar, pine martens, many species of birds such as hawks, eagles and owls, marine life including whales and even wolves and bears, although the proposed introduction of these would require consultation with local residents due to ill-deserved stigma and perceived danger (top predators like these usually leave humans alone). when introduced, these animals should be under protection by law from hunting and destruction of habitats.

attributes.action: Article 50 bill to include an executive confirmation referendum on 30/3/2017.
attributes.background: The article 50 act needs to be passed, but should include a 2nd referendum on 30/3/ 17 askng the UK public to confirm their  wish to leave the EU, in light of a very different world outlook. Peers and MPs would be supporting the democracy of the UK, giving the people a final but now informed choice
attributes.additional_details: The politics of the world are very different than 23 June 2016, when Trump and the option of hard Brexit was not a consideration. Much of the argument on both sides has proven to be false. Any reasonable individual would think it only right and proper to reflect and review a decision made in their personal life if circumstances changed. It is only right the UK population is allowed to do the same. A 2nd leave vote would however also give the UK govt a full and informed mandate from the people.

attributes.action: Make it that child maintenance payments come with visitation rights.
attributes.background: I pay maintenance for my children but still get stopped from seeing them. If the other parent takes payment from you you are entitled to see them without a court order if you are stopped from seeing them then payments should be reduced

attributes.action: Suspend all new legislation and submit to an independent legal compliancy audit
attributes.background: A substantial number of recent legal cases, political events and commentaries on regulatory changes have found the Government to be in breach, de facto and de jure, of a substantial number of its legal obligations under International Law, Human Rights Law, the Constitutional Law of the UK, etc.
attributes.additional_details:
Therefore, the Government should announce legislation to suspend all proposed legislative and regulatory changes, including those made under discretionary (budgetary and departmental) competences, and submit to a full legal compliancy audit by an independent company.

This audit will assess the legality, proportionality and justiciability of current legislation and policy, as well as the role of expert partners, such as the ONS, and stakeholders, in forming Government policy and legislation.

attributes.action: Action by parliament to stop the proliferation of graffiti in towns and cities.
attributes.background: Graffiti on buildings Is endemic throughout the UK. Measures should be place to stop this anti social practice and clean up the mess created. This should involve hefty fines, community service to remove graffiti and imprisonment for repeat offenders.

attributes.action: Make Jaywalking (crossing the road in undesignated places) An Offence
attributes.background: Jaywalking has become a serious problem in the UK, pedestrians have a total disregard for traffic. It is dangerous and results in many fatal accidents. The UK has plenty of Zebra crossings and pedestrian traffic  lights. It's a matter of life & death and it's time to make it an offence.
attributes.additional_details:
Jaywalking occurs when a pedestrian crosses a road where it's not safe to do so. Examples include crossing in middle of the road, between junctions, when a traffic light is green for traffic, or not by a zebra crossing. 
In Many countries, including the Australia, Belgium, Canada, France, Israel, Poland, USA and many other Countries, Jaywalking is an Offence

attributes.action: Allow a recall of mps petition without suspension or criminal charge
attributes.background: Currently the recall of mps bill only allows for a recall petition to be triggered if there is a criminal charge against your MP or if they have been suspended from the House. I believe that it should be possible to start a petition to recall your MP if you believe they aren't representing you.

attributes.action: Make Not Paying Taxi Fare a Crimnal Offence Oppose to a Civil Matter
attributes.background: When a passenger doesnt pay for a taxi ride either refusing or just simply run away and you call the Police, their response is its a civil matter not a criminal offence. Why is it not a criminal offence. The customer has not paid for a service provided by the taxi driver.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for dog and cat owners to have a licence
attributes.background:
It should be a legal requirement for a potential pet owner to possess a licence to have that animal.

There should be criminal records and background checks completed 
And a crackdown and some sort of policing to stop people from selling pets online

attributes.action: Honour Pharmacy by restricting the number of Pharmacy schools & graduates
attributes.background: Thousands of pharmacy graduates face the possibility of never registering due to the lack of pre-reg training placements available. As a result of the surplus supply of graduates. With many large multiples reducing their commitment to pre-reg training by 50%, making the situation considerably worse.
attributes.additional_details:
It is now vital for sweeping changes to be made. If the current approach is not addressed then sadly Pharmacy "strikes" maybe around the corner. As many dissatisfied professionals feel overworked & undervalued. 

Pharmacy will end becoming an unattractive profession, one incapable of attracting the brightest & the best undergraduates & retaining the newly qualifieds. With supply exceeding demand & universities unethically profiting from it. 

www.the-pda.org/pda-proposes-cutting-student-numbers/

attributes.action: Install adequately bright street-lighting on all stretches of all UK highways.
attributes.background:
Driving on motorways or on any roads during nighttime can be extremely difficult when the roads are not adequately lit up.
This problem is more severe during the winter period when the nights are longer, darker and prone to complicated weather conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
The amount of drivers using the roads of Great Britain is expanding constantly and the issue of desperately required lighting on all stretches of highways during night hours, which affects millions on a daily, or nightly, basis must be urgently addressed.
This urgent matter affects motorways and all grades of well used roads.

attributes.action: Make all UK Employee's pay the same rate of National Insurance.
attributes.background:
National Insurance is a tax and is applied to those earning above the upper earnings limit at a lower rate to those below the upper earnings
l
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is about tax fairness nothing else.
If the current standard/base rate was applied to all employee's the extra funds collected could be used to ease NHS funding or as Government see fit .

attributes.action: Capital gains tax should be levied on the sale of second homes.
attributes.background: The housing crisis is being exacerbated by the out of control practice of residential property being traded as a capital gains tax free investment. Every aspect of UK society would benefit by a capital gains tax being levied on the sale of all second homes.

attributes.action: Alcohol inflicted, minimum fee of £1,000.for Ambulance.
attributes.background:
I am a UK Citizen and  Retired with an Engineering background of 55 years or more.  
I have my First Aid Certificate which has come in very useful as on two occasions I have managed to keep two people alive, ( one from Drowning and one from  Car Accident ).
attributes.additional_details: I have various References From previous Employers over the years,  also from Solicitor and other Professional Bodys,  available if requested.

attributes.action: Make armed forces pay similar or inline with those in public services.
attributes.background: The fact that the armed forces personnel are away from families and loves ones and are only on or around £19000 p/a. This is with no overtime rates and to work unsociable hours and long periods of time away. Commitment bonuses are lessoning and and advance trade pay is non existent to better the job

attributes.action: Carbon tax products from countries reneging on their climate change commitments
attributes.background: UK taxpayers and businesses pay a considerable amount, though direct and indirect taxation, to help the country meet its climate change commitments.  However, some countries are making little effort to reduce carbon emissions, and some are reneging on agreed clime change commitments and treaties.

attributes.action: Tax footy transfers >£1m to fund NHS nurses & require firms to sponsor a nurse
attributes.background: All football transfer to be taxed at vat rate go towards NHS nurses funding in whole of uk. Any firm over a set size would be required to fund a nurses salary and uniform - any additional nurse funding by the same firm could be in part allowable against tax.

attributes.action: Any public promise made by any holder of public office to be legally binding.
attributes.background: Holders of public office frequently promise to act on behalf of those who, ultimately employ them.  They also frequently break those promises, usually with impunity.  This lessens public trust and engagement, particularly in the field of politics.
attributes.additional_details: When a public figure makes a promise they are, essentially, making a contract with those people who employ them, elect them, or pay their salaries.  In response to these promises, we elect them, or allow them to retain their position - it is only fair and right that they should be required to stick to their promises, and yet, time and again, they do not.  There is not, at the moment, any realistic sanction available to us to prevent this, so I am proposing that there should be.

attributes.action: Give commonwealth immigrants citizenship who lived in this country for 10 years
attributes.background: Most residents have started families here their children have never been out of the country. Most African countries now struggling economically than they were 10 years ago political instability, human rights abuses gender equality

attributes.action: Make voting in general elections, and in future referendums compulsory.
attributes.background: Given the historical sacrifices made over any number of years by countless groups and individuals to enfranchise the public, the public should be required to vote, even if the choice is "none of the above". The lack of voting is a distinct failing or our democracy.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all major UK roads and round-a-bouts to have CCTV
attributes.background: I am A university student at MMU. After experiencing a car crash on the underpass of Mancunion way on a major round-a-bout with both my flatmate and her friend. The police as helpful as they were, had no CCTV to catch the culprit.
attributes.additional_details:
The police, although busy, were wonderful in regards to the situation. After a Nissan Juke hitting a little car into a lamppost, the car was a write off. The man drove off, before we were even out of the car and the police, afterwards, informed us that there were no CCTV on the round-a-bout or on any of the roads in the direction he went.

I'm aware of multiple others having similar experiences, and feel that it would be both beneficial to the victims and the police to have CCTV on major roads.

attributes.action: Make the speed limits for larger vans the same as cars.
attributes.background: Transit sized vans are restricted to 50mph on single carriageways which anyone that drives one knows is not always a good thing. More time in your van means less work can be done.  Also it seems no one wants to be stuck behind a van at 50mph.  Reckless overtaking of vans is a common occurrence.
attributes.additional_details: Bringing the speed limit in line with cars would be a good thing and could possibly cause less accidents.  Vans are as safe as a lot of cars nowadays.

attributes.action: Change disabled parking signs to a D for disabled not a wheelchair
attributes.background: Disabled parking has a stigma attached you have to be in a wheel chair to use them but over 500000 people in the country how other disability where than don't need a wheel chair and are looked at as they should not park in the disabled  bays which is wrong
